t: Lee Morgan - Search For The New Land[LP] - Amazon.com Music
s: This LP was recorded in 1964 and is one of the best of Lee Morgan. Beautiful music and a good sound. However, like some other new release of Blue Note the pressing is not so good. The vinyl is noisy, with popping, even after thoroughly being cleaned. The bass is not very deep but rather flat.

s: Alfred Lion and Max Margulis established the BLUE NOTE label in 1939, with photographer Francis Wolff becoming involved shortly afterwards. The caliber of the musicians that recorded for Blue Note coupled with its stylized cover designs has made it one of the most legendary jazz labels of all time.

t: Amazon.com: Lee Morgan Vol 3: CDs & Vinyl
s: Many titles from Lee Morgan have been for years available only in the very expensive japanese edition. Vol.3 from 1957 is one of the few that are still not available in the normal series (connossoir or van gelder)and so, if you want to own it, you have to pay the high japanese ticket.

t: Amazon.com: The Sidewinder: CDs & Vinyl
s: Recorded at Van Gelder Studio in ... Lee Morgan was a runaway hit that reached number 25 on the Billboard chart. The title track, now a jazz standard, is one of the most influential recordings in soul jazz. All five tracks were written by Morgan and the album features respected tenor saxophonist, Joe Henderson. The Sidewinder will be reissued as part of an overall Blue Note 75th anniversary vinyl initiative ...

t: Morgan, Lee - Standards - Amazon.com Music
s: More than thirty years after its ... Lee Morgan's "Standards" was finally released for the first time in 1998. Why did it take Blue Note/Capitol so long to issue an album by one of its biggest stars of the 60s? Well, from 1965 to 1967, Lee recorded an amazing eleven albums worth of material, so it is easy to see how some of it sat in the vaults. But I am surprised that a solid session like this never got released in the 70s or 80s on vinyl like "Infinity," ...
